dialogues.speaker: ADELAIDE
dialogues.text: Shhh.... Shhhhh. Umbrae’s breath slows. She dies. EXT. TYLER’S CAR. NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: HONK HONK
dialogues.text: Adelaide goes to Zora’s door.

dialogues.speaker: ADELAIDE
dialogues.text: You okay? Zora nods and starts to break down.

dialogues.speaker: ADELAIDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay... Now get in the back.  77.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Zora slides out of the front seat and gets in the back. INT. TYLER’S CAR. DAWN The Wilsons drive in silence on the empty road. They sit in shock. The trauma has left them almost numb. scene looks like the aftermath of a very bad day at Disneyland.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SANTA CRUZ STREET. DAY
dialogues.text: The town seems absent of people. The Wilson’s drive the Tyler's car past a parked car in which all inhabitants ar dead. INT./EXT. TYLER’S CAR. SANTA CRUZ STREET. DAY Jason, in the backseat, tries his magic trick. He snaps a eventually a big spark shoots from his fingers. Surprised did it, he looks around for someone else who saw it. Zora gives him a bloody fist bump. Suddenly, Jason gets a weir look on his face. He looks ahead. The car turns a bend to find that the Wilson’s old car is flames, parked so that it blocks the road. Adelaide stops car.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Woah.

dialogues.speaker: ZORA
dialogues.text: That’s our car.

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: It’s him. It’s the one that looks like me. Suddenly. The left rear tire POPS then HISSES as it loose air, followed by the front left tire POPPING and HISSING. Adelaide shifts into reverse. Crippled, the car backs up, Pluto emerges in front of them in the beams of the headlights, holding his scissors, as the car makes a sad curve to the left and onto the curb.

dialogues.speaker: ADELAIDE
dialogues.text: Shit. Adelaide stops the car. Pluto stands in the road between and the flaming car.  78.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Adelaide grabs the fire poker and steps out.

dialogues.speaker: GABE ZORA
dialogues.text: Wait. Mom, no.

dialogues.speaker: ADELAIDE
dialogues.text: Stay in the car.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET. DAY
dialogues.text: Adelaide walks towards Pluto who steps back away from her

dialogues.speaker: ADELAIDE
dialogues.text: It’s okay...You don’t have to be afraid. I just want to talk to you... Pluto cocks his head. Cautiously intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: INT. TYLER'S CAR. DAY
dialogues.text: Gabe, Zora, and Jason watch on.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: What is she doing?

dialogues.speaker: ZORA
dialogues.text: She's talking to him.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ROAD. DAY
dialogues.text: Adelaide gets closer.

dialogues.speaker: ADELAIDE
dialogues.text: Nobody is going to hurt you. Just put it down. Pluto looks at his weapon, then back at Adelaide. He’s confused. He takes a step away from her, then stops. He l his mask revealing the burn marks.

dialogues.speaker: ADELAIDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s okay. Adelaide, carefully clutching her fire poker walks toward Pluto.

dialogues.speaker: ADELAIDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You don’t have to do this... She puts her hand out. Pluto He holds his hand out. Adela takes another cautious step towards him.  79. INT. TYLER’S CAR. DAY

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: He’s listening to her. Jason watches.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. ROAD. DAY
dialogues.text: Pluto leans out, looking past Adelaide, at the car. He ma eye contact with Jason in the back seat.. INT. TYLER’S CAR. DAY

dialogues.speaker: JASON
dialogues.text: No... It’s a trick. Jason gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Jason!

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET. DAY
dialogues.text: Pluto pulls down his mask. He clenches his scissors. Jason stops outside the car and Pluto matches his physicality. Realizing that Pluto is mirroring him, Jason takes a step backwards. Pluto follows suit. Jason starts walking backwards; Pluto copies him walking into the fire Gabe crumples out of the car. Adelaide almost instinctively lunges after him. Pluto goe in flames. Just then, Red, camouflaged by a red truck grabs Jason an runs... Adelaide turns but doesn’t see Jason.

dialogues.speaker: ADELAIDE
dialogues.text: Jason. She runs. Gabe tries to limp towards the darkness where Red took Ja Zora exits too, but doesn’t make it very far before she l sight of Jason and breaks down. She screams. Adelaide doesn’t stop.  80.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Addy! Adelaide runs towards the amusement park.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BOARDWALK. DAY
dialogues.text: Adelaide walks briskly down the empty boardwalk. A few bodies’ bodies litter the ground.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. BEACH BY BOARDWALK. DAY
dialogues.text: In the near distance, a line of people hold hands, facing away from her. The line extends from the water’s edge to the amusement park and into the distance. One of the men the line is the man Jason saw earlier. He has the same fa as the homeless man who was stabbed in the beginning. Adelaide turns to the “Merlin’s Forest” entrance and walk inside it. INT. MERLIN’S FOREST. MIRROR ROOM. DAY Adelaide walks into the dark maze. It’s the same as befor inside. She retraces her steps from 25 years earlier. She finds her way to the same corridor where the attack occur She walks through the dark opening Young Red came from. S finds a wall and pushes the surface and it opens a crack then the door swings open. A white rabbit hops out of the open door at Adelaide’s feet. Adelaide steps over the rab and cautiously into the empty dark space.

dialogues.speaker: INT. CONTROL ROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: She's ready to strike. Inside is a maintenance and techni control room. At the end of the control room there’s wall. She pushes i and it opens like a door revealing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adelaide gets on a downward moving escalator.  175 81.

dialogues.speaker: INT. ESCALATOR. DAY
dialogues.text: Adelaide stands and waits. She moves down though the darkness. Eventually she sees light below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adelaide exits into a room that looks like a corner of an underground mall. She turns a corner into-

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE UNDERPASS. MAIN TUNNEL. DAY
dialogues.text: The tunnel feels like a publicly funded underground compo The only beings who seem to populate it now are Rabbits w hop around freely on the ground. All the doors are open. Adelaide walks cautiously, stepping past and over rabbits down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE UNDERPASS. DAY
dialogues.text: Adelaide walks down the hallway. She passes the first ope door. The cafeteria is empty of people. The rabbit cages all open and empty. She keeps walking and passes the next door. It’s an empty room with rows of tables. Each table has crude sewing equipment, rabbit fur, and pelts. It’s a tidy and uniform sweat shop style workspace. Adelaide keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. STREET. DAY
dialogues.text: Zora helps Gabe hobble towards the boardwalk. Bodies are scattered. The sun rises. She holds her golf club and JAs geode.

dialogues.speaker: ZORA
dialogues.text: What does it sound like when a pterodactyl goes to the bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ZORA
dialogues.text: Nothing. The “P” is silent.  82.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: The “p”? There’s no “p” in Pterodactyl.

dialogues.speaker: ZORA
dialogues.text: Yes there is.

dialogues.speaker: ZORA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who's gonna clean all this up?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Not me.

dialogues.speaker: ZORA
dialogues.text: Is it the end of the world?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Nah. The world isn’t gonna end. It’s just gonna be different-- Zora stops and cries.

dialogues.speaker: ZORA
dialogues.text: I don’t want it to be different.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Mom's... Mom knows what to do, okay? She said meet her. She knows.... He gets choked up, but stuffs it down. Zora continues. They arrive near the boardwalk. An abandoned ambulance is parked in the street, its rear doors open.

dialogues.speaker: GABE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here. We can wait here. They got bandages and stuff.

dialogues.speaker: ZORA
dialogues.text: Look. Gabe does. Far head of them is the line of people holding each others bloody hands. The line starts at the shore an disappears through the city.

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Get in. They hide in the back of the ambulance. They peek out. Another woman adds herself to the stoic, frightening scen Zora starts to panic.  83.

dialogues.speaker: GABE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s some... That’s some scary shit.

dialogues.speaker: ZORA
dialogues.text: What are they doing?

dialogues.speaker: GABE
dialogues.text: Looks like some kind of... fucked up performance art. Zora looks at her dad like “You've got to be kidding me.”

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE UNDERPASS. CLASSROOM HALLWAY. DAY
dialogues.text: Deeper in “The Underpass,” Adelaide arrives at the door o empty classroom. She stops. Adelaide enters the...

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE UNDERPASS. CLASSROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: The classroom isn’t too different from a standard public school classroom; rows of desks and chairs. Red stands at the front of the class facing the chalkboar She SNIPS PAPER carefully with her scissors. Adelaide walks to the center row of the class behind Red.

dialogues.speaker: ADELAIDE
dialogues.text: Where is he...?

dialogues.speaker: RED
dialogues.text: How it must have been to grow up with the sky. To feel the sun, the wind, the trees. But your people took it for granted. We’re human too, you know. Eyes. Teeth. Hands. Blood. Exactly like you.

dialogues.speaker: INT. UNDERPASS HALLWAY. DAY
dialogues.text: We move through the empty Underpass.

dialogues.speaker: RED
dialogues.text: And yet, it was humans that built this place.  84.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: I believe they figured out how to make a copy of the body, but not the soul. The soul remains one, shared by two. They created the Tethered so they could use them to control the ones above. Like puppets. Adelaide looks around for Jason but doesn’t see him anywh She moves through walking towards Red’s back. She just SN away.

dialogues.speaker: RED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But they failed, and they abandoned the Tethered. For generations the Tethered continued without direction. They all went mad down here. And then... there was us.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FLASHBACK. SANTA CRUZ BOARDWALK 1986. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Russell throws the ball at the bottle toss booth like bef Rayne and Young Adelaide watch.

dialogues.speaker: RED
dialogues.text: You remember? We were born special.

dialogues.speaker: INT. FLASHBACK. UNDERPASS. NIGHT
dialogues.text: WEYLAND, Russel’s doppleganger, EARTHA, Rayne’s dopplegan Young Red and TONY, the bottle toss attendant’s doppleganger, engage in a darker version of the same acti The Underpass version is crazy, morbid; wordless. Like a ritual in an insane asylum. We toggle between both flashbacks showing their symmetry until we see the cafeteria where the Tethered are eating bunnies.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE UNDERPASS. CLASSROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: Red continues cutting paper as Adelaide approaches slowly from behind.

dialogues.speaker: RED
dialogues.text: God brought us together that night.  85.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. FLASHBACK. SANTA CRUZ BOARDWALK. WHACK A MOLE. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Young Adelaide’s attention is drawn by THUNDER coming fro the beach.

dialogues.speaker: INT. FLASHBACK. UNDERPASS. WHACK A MOLE BOOTH. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Young Red is drawn towards the escalator.

dialogues.speaker: INT. FLASHBACK. VISIONQUEST 1986. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Young Red turns towards Young Adelaide at the threshold o darkness. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: ADELAIDE
dialogues.text: I never stopped thinking about you. How things could have been. How you could have taken me with you.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE UNDERPASS. BARRACKS. DAY
dialogues.text: Young Red stares at the hand across America t-shirt which ceremonially hanged inside of a locker.

dialogues.speaker: RED
dialogues.text: Years after we met, the miracle happened.

dialogues.speaker: INT. FLASHBACK. DANCE RECITAL. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Teen Adelaide dances.

dialogues.speaker: INT. FLASHBACK. UNDERPASS. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Teen Red dances.

dialogues.speaker: RED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That’s when I saw God, and he showed me my path. You felt it too.  86.

dialogues.speaker: INT. FLASHBACK. UNDERPASS. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Teen Red finishes her dance. The Tethered audience surrou and reaches for Teen Red.

dialogues.speaker: RED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: The end of our dance the Tethered saw that I was different, that I would deliver them from this misery.

dialogues.speaker: RED
dialogues.text: I found my faith and I began to prepare. It took years to plan. INT. FLASHBACKS. UNDERPASS BARRACKS 24 HOURS EARLIER. Gloves are put on, sandals and red jump suits zipped up. Tethered regular clothing is placed on folded on beds.

dialogues.speaker: RED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It took years to plan.

dialogues.speaker: INT. PRESENT DAY. UNDERPASS CLASSROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: Adult Red looks at the shrine on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: RED, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Everything had to be perfect. I didn’t just need to kill you. I needed to make a statement that the whole world would see.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE UNDERPASS. CLASSROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: Red holds up what she’s been cutting. It’s a chain of red construction paper cut into the shape of four people hold hands. The sudden motion stops Adelaide in her tracks.

dialogues.speaker: RED
dialogues.text: It’s our time now. Our time up there. Red continues cutting until there are only two paper figu left. Red turns to Adelaide.  87.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: RED (CONT’D) And to think, if it weren’t for you, I never would’ve danced at all. Adelaide continues down the center aisle between the chai towards Red.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC
dialogues.text: The two begin to circle one another. FLASHBACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen-year-old Adelaide steps on stage to begin her ba recital in front of a rapt audience. It’s classic and beautiful. INT. THE UNDERPASS. CLASSROOM HALLWAY. 1993. Fourteen-year-old Red stands in on of the rooms of “The Underpass” in front of a of shadowy people observing. She steps out and begins her dance down the line. Her movemen are primal, visceral and dark. PRESENT DAY...

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE UNDERPASS. CLASSROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: The two fight. Adelaide rushes towards Red with the fire poker overhead. Red parries with her scissor and pokes Adelaide in the shoulder and walks away circling Adelaide around the perimeter of the classroom. Adelaide starts pursuing her. FLASHBACK...

dialogues.speaker: INT. BALLET. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Fourteen-year-old Adelaide’s ballet is elegant and beauti She dances with a partner that’s not there. INT. UNDERPASS. CLASSROOM HALLWAY. 1993. Fourteen-year-old Red turns heads as she dances. She port a girl lost and frightened in a maze.  88.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE UNDERPASS. CLASSROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: Adelaide runs at Red on the other side of the room. Red k a desk dislodging an entire row of desks towards Adelaide Adelaide changes direction accordingly and swings at Red. dodges and pokes Adelaide in her side. Again, she walks a quickly, rounding some desks to reposition herself on the other side of the room. FLASHBACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen-year-old Adelaide’s dance continues, picking up steam. INT. UNDERPASS. CLASSROOM HALLWAY. 1993. Fourteen year-old Red dances in fear. She clutches her ne and convulses in pain. PRESENT DAY...

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE UNDERPASS. CLASSROOM. DAY
dialogues.text: Adelaide, hurt, rises. She starts towards Red diagonally crossing the room. She pushes the desks out of her way th time, clearing a sloppy path. She swings at Red who dodge The fire poker sticks in the wall. Adelaide can’t immedia dislodge it. Red attack with open scissors. Adelaide take her hands off the poker and blocks the scissors with the handcuff chain. Red kicks Adelaide who flies over some de Red runs out the door. FLASHBACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen-year-old Adelaide starts to run with her dance.

dialogues.speaker: INT. UNDERPASS. CLASSROOM HALLWAY. 1993. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Fourteen-year-old Red starts to run in her dance.  89.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE UNDERPASS. CLASSROOM HALLWAY. DAY
dialogues.text: The chase explodes into the main tunnel. Red backs up as Adelaide pursues her. They manage to avoid stepping on rabbits. FLASHBACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen-year-old Adelaide spins perfectly.

dialogues.speaker: INT. UNDERPASS. CLASSROOM HALLWAY. 1993. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Fourteen-year-old Red portrays a body being dragged throu the tunnel. PRESENT DAY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adelaide chases Red around a corner. A new hallway extend front and behind her. FLASHBACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourteen-year-old Adelaide delicately caresses her arms w standing en pointe..

dialogues.speaker: INT. UNDERPASS. CLASSROOM HALLWAY. 1993. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Fourteen-year-old Red reaches to the ceiling with heartbr longing. PRESENT DAY...

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE UNDERPASS. BARRACKS HALLWAY. DAY
dialogues.text: Adelaide pins Red against the door. Her fire poker up aga Red’s scissors. Adelaide smiles as she pushes. Then Red quickly separates the two sides of the scissors and pokes Adelaide in the side with one of the blades sending her reeling back. Red slips through the door into...  90.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE UNDERPASS. BARRACKS. DAY
dialogues.text: Rows of bunks line the empty, red-tiled sleeping quarters It's dark. Adelaide charges in. Red is nowhere to be seen Adelaide stalks through the bunks. The MUSIC crescendoes. Red emerges from the shadows behind one bunk with a huge sneak attack. Adelaide turns, just in time. FLASHBACK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both girls prepare for their huge finale. As the MUSIC PEAKS... Sixteen-year-old Adelaide runs and leaps landing perfectl with no partner.

dialogues.speaker: INT. UNDERPASS. CLASSROOM HALLWAY. 1993. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Fourteen-year-old Red’s sorrow turns to rage she runs an leaps but falls to the floor hard. PRESENT DAY...

dialogues.speaker: INT. UNDERPASS. BARRACKS. DAY
dialogues.text: Red has been run through by the fire poker. She falls to floor. Adelaide stands over her.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE UNDERPASS. BARRACKS. DAY
dialogues.text: Adelaide picks up and places Red’s limp body on the bed a sits next to it. Red begins to whistle “ITSY BITSY SPIDER.” Adelaide pushes the chain from her handcuffs into Red’s n Chocking her.. Adelaide weeps, but her weeping turns into LAUGHTER. Red struggles and dies; Her face goes soft in the end.  91.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A NOISE takes her out of it. She turns sharply. She walks over to an industrial locker/closet with ventilation slat it. She opens it. Jason stands inside, trembling. His eye and mouth wide open in shock. Adelaide hugs him hard and weeps happily.

dialogues.speaker: ADELAIDE
dialogues.text: There you are, my love. I found you! He is frozen in fear.

dialogues.speaker: ADELAIDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look. She starts wiping his tears but smears blood across his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: ADELAIDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They’re all gone now, ok? They can’t hurt you. You understand. .? Jason? Do you? Everything is going to be like it was before. She starts to shake him. And realizes he’s afraid of her. stops and an awful expression comes over her face. He hea She keeps wiping his cheek obsessively but just smears mo and more blood.

dialogues.speaker: ADELAIDE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s going to be like before and you will never have to leave me. I promise. Never, ever, ever, ever...

dialogues.speaker: INT. AMBULANCE. DAY
dialogues.text: Gabe and Zora hide inside. Zora goes to the back window a opens the door. They turn to see Adelaide arrive with Jas in tow. MOMENTS LATER... The ambulance drives. We see each persons’ traumatized fa Jason watches his mother.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSELL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What...? She wasn’t in Nam’; she got lost for fifteen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FOSTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That can be very scary.  92.

dialogues.speaker: RAYNE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We don’t know what happened to her. FLASHBACK... INT. PSYCHIATRIST’S OFFICE. DAY Young Adelaide listens to her parents talk to the psychiatrist.

dialogues.speaker: RUSSELL
dialogues.text: So, how do we get her to talk? INT. THE WILSON’S BAYSIDE HOUSE. BASEMENT. DAY The mini home ballet studio. Young Adelaide practices methodically in front of the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: DR. FOSTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I think we need to encourage her to draw, write... dance... anything to help her tell us her story... but we have to be patient.

dialogues.speaker: INT. VISION QUEST PORTAL. NIGHT
dialogues.text: We are inside the Vision Quest portal looking out at the beach and ocean. Young Adelaide, (the real one) stands by water. Lightning bursts in the distance over the ocean. T beckoned by the mysterious portal, she walks towards us. It’s the same shot we saw earlier but now we also see the reverse. Young Red stands hiding half behind a mirrored w inside. She’s wickedly entranced by the sight of approach Young Adelaide. She backs up into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE UNDERPASS. MAIN HALLWAY. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Young Red drags Young Adelaide as a few people mill aroun There are no rabbits on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE UNDERPASS. BARRACKS. 1986. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Young Red stands by the bed with Young Adelaide unconscio in it. She leaves.  93.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE UNDERPASS. BARRACKS. 1986. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Young Adelaide tries to get up, but finds her hand tether to the bed frame by a pair of custom-made, brass handcuff Young Red (now just “Adelaide”) is gone. She’s alone. She struggles and starts to cry when... Other figures arrive, back from dinner. They move slowly are obscured with shadow. Eartha and Weyland, the other versions of Adelaide’s parents, approach her silently. Th stand over the bed.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ADELAIDE
dialogues.text: (Her voice is rough from having been choked) Mom! Dad! I wanna go home. Eartha and Weyland look at each other. They don’t underst her words. Young Adelaide realizes they are not her paren Eartha pets her on the head. INT. RAYNE’S CAR. NIGHT Rayne, drives Russell and Young Adelaide away from the boardwalk. The rain has picked up. Rayne and Russell argu but Young Adelaide, in the back, focuses on a far away thought. Slowly she begins to smile. This is not Young Adelaide, it’s the other little girl from below. PRESENT DAY...

dialogues.speaker: CUE
dialogues.text: Birds-eye view follows the ambulance driving inland, towa the country before we diverge towards the open terrain. A continue through the sky, we find the row of people stand hand-in-hand. We follow it. The line goes on, and on, and on towards the rising sun.
